note_content.Chief Complaint: Experiencing chest pain and shortness of breath.
note_content.History of Present Illness: The patient has been experiencing intermittent chest pain and discomfort, particularly after physical exertion, for the past two weeks. Symptoms include shortness of breath and occasional dizziness.
note_content.Past Medical History: Has a history of hypertension and high cholesterol, managed with medication. No previous cardiac events.
note_content.Family History: Father had a heart attack at age 65; mother has diabetes.
note_content.Social History: Smoker for 40 years, approximately 10 cigarettes per day. Minimal alcohol intake. Works as a construction manager.
note_content.Review of Systems: Recently noted increased fatigue, specifically in the late afternoons. No fevers, night sweats, or weight loss.
note_content.Current Medications: Lisinopril 10 mg once daily, Atorvastatin 20 mg once daily.
note_content.Vital Signs: Blood pressure 155/90 mmHg, Pulse 88 bpm, Temperature 98.6 F, Respiratory rate 18 bpm.
note_content.Physical Examination: Physical exam shows mild distress due to chest pain; cardiovascular exam reveals regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs, rubs, or gallops.
note_content.Investigations: ECG performed showing slight ST-segment elevation; immediate cardiology consultation advised.
note_content.Assessment and Plan: Preliminary diagnosis of unstable angina. Plan to admit for further cardiac workup including echocardiography, and potential cardiac catheterization if warranted. Modify antihypertensive medication and increase statin dose.
